N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2302.2 - State staff organization

State Regulations
(a) The E.S.E.A. title IV program in New York State will be coordinated by the
commissioner's office through the office of the Executive Deputy Commissioner
of Education and the Office for Program Analysis and Evaluation. The
commissioner's office will have responsibility for staffing the advisory
council, performing the overall program evaluation function (Office for Program

Analysis and Evaluation--Bureau for Program Planning and Evaluation), and
formulating policy for the activities associated with strengthening State
educational departments. The Board of Regents will have the responsibility for
approving the program plan. (b) The

Deputy Commissioner for Elementary, Secondary and Continuing Education will
have supervisory responsibility for all components of the program within his
areas including parts B and C, strengthening local planning and evaluation, and
those elementary, secondary and continuing education activities under the
strengthening of State education component of the program. The Assistant

Commissioner for Regents Examinations, Scholarships and Evaluation will
coordinate the program in the ESC area for the deputy commissioner and will
work with the various associate commissioners who will have administrative
responsibility for the activities in their particular areas. (c) The Deputy Commissioner for Higher and

Professional Education will have responsibility for the activities funded to
strengthen State education agencies in that area. The Associate Commissioner
for Cultural Education will have like responsibilities in that area. Notes
